topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 : Installation Overview

body.p: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 is a carrier-grade distribution of OpenStack, the leading open source cloud computing platform.
HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade provides communications service providers (CSPs) with an open source based cloud platform that meets their demanding reliability requirements.
body.section: The following documentation has been organized to help you locate information for specific types of activities, such as installation, administration, operations, and VNF integration. It further provides guidelines and rules to assist the cloud architects, installers, and administrators in deploying the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade (HCG) 4.0.

Installing HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0This section describes various installation options that are available with HCG 4.0. Irrespective of any option that you select, to install HCG 4.0 successfully, you need to perform three important steps. Failure to follow these recommendations will likely compromise reliability and performance:
(READ THIS FIRST)
STEP 1 - Download the installation packages.
STEP 2 - You need to apply a Horizon Bundle for installing the cloud. For more information on STEP 1 and STEP 2, refer to the cloud installation section.
STEP 3 - To complete the installation, follow the instructions in the installation guides given below:
HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 installation for CPE systemsThis document provides information and instructions for installing and configuring HCG 4.0 for CPE systems (Customer Premises Equipment). CPE is intended for small applications only. It runs on two physical nodes. Each node provides both the controller and compute functions.
Reference Link - HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 installation for cpe systems.pdf
HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 installation for systems with controller storage
This document provides information and instructions for installing HCG 4.0 configurations for controller storage systems that are initially deployed using LVM-backed block storage on controller nodes. The uses two controller nodes and (n) compute nodes (minimum two recommended for redundancy). Persistent storage for VMs is implemented on the controller nodes. Reference Link - HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 installation for systems with controller storage.pdf
HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 installation for systems with dedicated storage
This document provides information and instructions for installing and configuring HCG 4.0 for dedicated storage systems that uses two controller nodes, (n) compute nodes, and a storage cluster consisting of up to eight storage nodes (paired for redundancy). Persistent storage for VMs is implemented on the storage cluster, offering greater scalability.
Reference Link - HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 installation for systems with dedicated storage.pdf
HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 for regions
This document provides installation and configuration information for deploying HCG 4.0 in any of the supported Regions configurations.
Reference Link - HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 for regions.pdf

li.b: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 4.0 software development kit
li.p: The HCG 4.0 Software Development Kit (SDK) provides drivers, daemons, API libraries,and configuration files that you can include in a guest image to leverage the extended capabilities of HCG 4.0. These components can be used to enhance or extend the networking features of the applications and to access the virtual machine (VM) management capabilities of HCG 4.0.
